oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Uncle Bob's cabin at Belle Meade Plantation
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Unidentified African American individuals seated on the porch of Uncle Bob's cabin at Belle Meade Plantation.

John Harding purchased the land in 1807 and he and his family lived in the cabin for several years until the Belle Meade home was completed in 1820. Slaves lived in the cabin between the 1820's and Civil War. The cabin was later occupied by Robert "Bob" Green who helped with the Thoroughbred program and Belle Meade Stud farm.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Belle Meade Plantation (Tenn.); Plantations--Tennessee
Plantations; Log cabins
